reviews.text: Desi... the food has been just okay, not great every time I’ve been. Ordered delivery for the first time and it was quick and food was hot, but as always- gravy is thin and watery as opposed to thick and rich, and both the paneer and chicken don’t have much flavor. I like the staff and service but the same dishes taste better from New Delhi or Indian Sizzler.

4 stars for the food, 2 for atmosphere: too bright lights, glass table tops covering the table cloths (hate that), no music so the place was oddly quiet. These are simple fixes. Next time it's take out.

I started off with a indebluetini ($12) which tasted like mango lassi with alcohol. For appetizer, we had the vegetable samosa chaat which were delicious. You can never go wrong with samosas! Now for the meal, we ordered 4 orders of naan, two curries; chicken tikka masala and madras. Both lacked flavor and tasted nothing like it should. Super boring..there wasn't anything about it that wowed us. For the naan, each person had 1 full naan which did make sense if it cost $3... that's extremely pricey for plain bread. Now each dish typically comes with a side of rice. For the two curries we had, we got 1 rice to share between 4 people. I honestly don't understand logic. I personally didn't like IndeBlue, the foods overpriced and bland so for that reason I'm giving it 2 stars.

I would give this restaurant zero stars if I could...the experience was awful.  It was hot in the restaurant so I asked for ice for my tap water only to be told that they do not have ice because white people don't use ice but black people do and since the area was white they don't have ice.

I ordered Chicken Makhani and it was disgusting.  Sauce taste like spaghetti sauce from a jar and the chicken was hard.  My friend ordered Lamb Vindaloo and it was mediocre at best.  

I will never eat at this restaurant again...far too many quality Indian restaurants to go to in University City.  TWO THUMBS DOWN!!!!!
Great little Indian restaurant on Baltimore Ave in West Philly. There were four of us, and all enjoyed their meals. Bread basket recommend.

The ambiance is sophisticated and festive. The servers are professional and knowledgeable, attentive without hovering. The food is incredible. I haven't eaten here for a few years, so I was delighted to find new dishes on the menu. My meal was perfectly seasoned and plated. I will eat here again!

Very romantic place for a random husband and wife date night. Our server was very knowledgeable and on top of his game. The food was amazing, we had an absolutely lovely time! Would def go back again to this location.

This restaurant greets you as an old friend.  Friendly, happy to answer any questions and polite.  Amanda was our waitress.  She was just perfect.  She anticipated our needs and was very attentive.   The food is out of this world.  From the stuffed mushrooms to the filet with caramelized scallops, the dining experience is the best. We will be back every time we visit our children.

To

Just enjoyed a wonderful meal with my girlfriend for a late valentines dinner. Our server Antonio had excellent recommendations for whiskey and food! Great place to go for a nice meal without totally breaking the bank! Thanks Antonio!

PHENOMENAL!!!

Scallops were incredible. Highly recommend! Request Matthew as your server, best service I have received in a long time.

We has a great meal!  We had a party of 6 and the restaurant accommodated us with no issues.  The separation of courses allowed us to talk and catch up without being rushed.  Everyone enjoyed the food and drinks.  The manager stopped by our table and greeted us as well.  We will definitely go back.

I had dinner at Sullivan's with another couple Saturday night and the meal and service was outstanding for everyone. I have eaten at the Sullivan's in Raleigh many times, yet this is the first time in quite a while, that I have had the opportunity to dine at this location. I highly recommend the Calamari as an appetizer. The Wedge was great, but I am a big fan of blue cheese, but simply great. The Filet was prepared exactly to my liking and was  great too. My wife ordered Sea Bass and I had a bite and it was very good and I am no much of a fish eater.

Very good food and meticulous service. If you have a gluten allergy ask them to leave the complimentary bread out when they box up your food.  I didn't know they did that and had to throw away my left over steak that I had saved for lunch the next day.  The server apparently isn't the one that boxes the food as she knew about the allergy and was very helpful.  Was unable to get a manager to call me back so I could share my experience to help the next person.

This was mine and my wife's first time eating at Sullivan's. The staff was amazing and super nice. We got the filet, asparagus and mushrooms and must say it was some of the best food I've eaten anywhere. We will definitely be going back. It was my birthday and they really provided me a top notch meal thank you.

Service at the bar was phenomenal.  Great for asking about recommended drinks and food on the menu.  Warning:  They do have a cigar lounge next to the bar, so if you do not like the smell of cigar smoke, then be cautious.

We had the classic pasta special.  Great value for 1 app, 2 pasta entrees 1 dessert plus two orders of pasta for carryout all for $40 something.  Wow.  Plus the pasta is really good. Service very good.  Some of the waiters have been there for years meaning must be well managed. And they recognize previous customers.

Consistently delicious. Also crowded and loud, as a rule, but attentive service and great food help you forget about that!

I've sampled the menu from steaks to seafood, and pasta to poultry, and never been disappointed. 

Atmosphere and pricing are upscale but not snooty. This is a place you can take a date, your family, business contacts -- anyone, really.

Pro tip: Treat yourself to dessert.
Every time we go, we love it.  It is fantastic for large groups and late night. Great drinks, great food, and very good service.  You just can't go wrong.

Dinner was delicious!! Best meal I have had in a long time and so much food got another meal to bring home basically. Our waitress Chrissy was super friendly and nice and helpful with recommendations. I will definitely be back!!!

I’ve dined in the party space once and had catering from here but this was my first time dining in the main seating area. I had a great brunch experience and I can’t wait to return. The butter cake French toast did not disappoint. It was a mash up of dessert and breakfast that left me stuffed. My guest ordered the All-American platter and he kept raving about the potatoes. If you plan on coming here, check out the website for a coupon that will be sent to your email. It can get busy here so I highly recommend making a reservation. This is a definitely a family style restaurant so large parties are welcome. What ever you do, try to resist the complimentary bread because we made the mistake of eating too much, and couldn’t finish our entrees. This is one of the best options in the area for classic Italian that will far exceed your expectations for a chain establishment.

I stayed at the Radisson almost a month ago. The room we stayed in was freezing, even when I turned up the thermostat. We went to get into bed and there was a HUGE stain on the sheet, to the point where we had to pull it off to sleep in the bed. I woke up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, and when I turned on the bathroom light, a bug went crawling across the floor. I also was taking the elevator to an event that I was going to the night I stayed there, and the elevator smelled of vomit, and when I told the front desk about it, they just glared at me and said they'd let someone know. It still smelled of vomit 4 hours later. Not to mention that we are almost a month after our stay, and we STILL have yet to receive our deposit of $50 back. I have called 6 times, and have left NUMEROUS voicemails, and still have yet to receive a response.  I was also told my room would be comped for the trouble, and I have yet to see that either. Will not be staying here again.
Room is outdated.  Toilet seat was broken and you are left to your own GPS mentality to locate the Casino.  The people however, are friendly, the service good and the location is close to many shops.

My organization used the ballroom and smaller rooms for an event. They were clean and well organized. Had no problem when I asked for a few things. The staff responded quickly. They did a good job managing the large group of students as well.
Nice hotel.  Convenient to local expo center.  Needs to work on the plumbing problems in my room.
Great venue for events with lots of people. Their catering is usually very good.

Crab cake and seasonal dry aged rib eye steak are made to perfection. However the porterhouse steak was not as amazing in comparison. If you are looking for juicy, strong flavour of beef and tender meat, dry aged rib eye is definitely the wise choice. Overall portion is quite big, especially for the sides.
Never disappointing. Personable staff remember my name. Food prepared to perfection. Monthly special menus keep things interesting with excellent seasonal offerings.

I love the sliders at this place! It's perfect as a quick snack. The bun is so fresh and delicious and the meat is cooked to perfection! 

The service is professional and welcoming.

Morton's has grown to over 74 restaurants, but the vision is the same today as it was when we opened our first restaurant in Chicago in 1978. Quality. Consistency. Genuine Hospitality. Prime Beef at Morton's is aged for 23-28 days is so  delicious.
crab cake  is also a yummy dish.
Probably the best steakhouse in town! Well choices of steak cut and cooked very well! Food other than steak is a bit salty though

Lovely night to spend with family and friends.  The side dishes were prepared to perfection--especially the sweet potatoes.  Biggest concern---my steak was way over cooked.  Ordered it medium rare....warm red center and it came out well done.  Not even a sign of pink.  This shouldn't happen at a top notch steak house.
Wait staff was awesome and food was superb. It’s tradition for us to find a Ruth Chris where ever we travel too. This one did not disappoint! Wonderful experience.

Totally overrated.  Ate here last night with a group of ten. Had the petite filet.  Said to the waiter that I wanted it cooked medium rare plus and then said maybe it should be medium.  He told me that it cooks very fast and I should order it medium rare.  I said okay and chose to have it cooked without butter.  I like to taste the meat.  You can put butter on feathers and it will taste great.  I guess that when they cook it and add the butter it makes the meat taste better than it really is.  So out comes our dinner and my steak is RARE and not even close to medium rare.   I ate a few bites because I was really hungry and I noticed it had a lot of pepper on it.  I finally flagged down our waiter and showed him the steak.  He agreed that it was rare and offered to bring me a hot plate, whatever good that would do, or take it back and cook it some more, which would probably dry the steak.  Since most of our party was well along in the meal, I opted to finish my steak, which by the way was not that good.  Maybe I should have had the butter.  I have had better meat from Costco prime steaks.  What a waste of money!

Consistency fantastic, the food is always delicious and the steak us done to perfection. 
We shared a large rib eye steak, medium rare, a mouth watering experience. The salads were fantastic as well- my wife enjoyed the Wedge and I loved the arugula salad.
The service is always top notch,  and our waiter Alex was attentive, friendly and made it a very pleasant evening. The martinis were great, and the cheesecake dessert with the salted caramel was devine. Obviously we will back!

Dined with family and friends and was not disappointed. The choice of steak and extensive side dishes was excellent. All our steaks were cooked as ordered and would recommend this restaurant to steak lovers visiting Waikiki. A little on the pricey side for a steak house but well worth it.

Service was awesome! Server was always super attentive even for refill my water. And give me tips about sauces and what to mix with them.

The food was so fresh! I really enjoyed everything overall. I went for the Restaurant week and they have a special menu with nice prices. Other than a full menu experience is a highly cost.

The only downside for me, I don't eat anything spicy. I always explained that and request nothing spicy on my dishes. I have a limited tasted for spiciness that I can handle. Nothing in my order was supposedly spicy but the sausage was. Worst part is that the sausage was the first thing I tried and after that all my broth was contaminated with the flavor. So all the rest of the items tasted similar to the sausage.

For me, sausage (separating if it's or not spicy) it's not the best option to cook on broth and I think they should know better. 

Neither the pasta nor the vegetables balls were my favorite.

Interesting concept. Great service all around. Quality of proteins was very good. My only complaint if I have one is with four people it is difficult to cook enough at once on the small grill pan on the table. Which translated into quite a long dinner.

Always have a good experience going to Melting Pots. The staff have always been very nice, helpful and friendly. The food is phenomenal, nothing like it anywhere else. It can be expensive and they could have a few more drink options, but overall it's a great place for high end dining.

The new menu items were fantastic. Melting pot continues to push the envelope and redefine what it means to be an amazing restaurant, let alone one that serves fondue. The staff was extremely professional, provided excellent recommendations and were incredibly attentive. I would definitely come here again.

Today I visited for the first time and was delighted with the service. My friend came from Puerto Rico and I mentioned it to our server and she came with a plate decorated in chocolate letters saying Welcome to Bethlehem and the Puertorican flag. That was so awesome and great customer service. The fondue was good and the ambiance.  We had a great first time, totally recommend it.

Peppers is a great place to have a party. I recently hosted a  large  birthday luncheon there.   The arrangements were perfect and the staff was very accommodating with  last minute changes that occurred. The food was excellent,  the service impeccable and the cost was  very reasonable.  I would not hesitate to recommend this fine restaurant. I have also gone there for dinner at various times and have never been disappointed.

Excellent food and service. Prices are fair. Service always good. Very good for large parties. we go here often for family birthdays ect. Package plans have good menu selection and flat fee per person
Always great food. No matter what you have. Friendly, knowledgeable service. Perfect place for a late night dinner.

Tuesday night karaoke is awesome from 8:30-11:30 PM with DJ Dance Daddy Lots of talent and the best pulled pork broccoli rabe sandwich I have ever tasted. The bands they book are amazing too! Love this place.

I have to agree with some of the other reviewers, the food was not something that would make me want to be back again. 
 I enjoy going to family owned Italian restaurants because normally the food is exponentially better that the large chain restaurants, this meal however IMO was a little bland and under seasoned. The wait staff was a little less attentive than I would expect, it took 12 minutes after I moved my plate and put my napkin on the table before the waiter came by to see of I was finished.

Best place for happy hour EVER!!
Everyone in our party received their first drink for free plus free food!!  Chicken wings, nachos, fries, veggies and a whole lot more all for FREE!!!  The best deal EVER!!  We will be going back there soon for sure!!
The food was good. Very nice atmosphere. The staff was friendly. It was very expensive tho.

The cheese cake factory is an old favorite of mine. My family and I would come here for special occasions when I was a child and I loved their Linda Fudge cake. They still have it!!! And it is as delicious as ever! Since I’ve grown into adulthood some 15 years later, they have switched up the menu and still have a great handle on the savory tastes they’ve always fished out. I’ll keep coming, and I’ll bring my kids here too.

The bartenders terrible attitude defined my experience. Calling the dining room manager a tool would b giving him a compliment. I could have given 5 Stars if they would have handled my complaint better. It's a great place in a great location

Big disappointment at this location.

We very much like The Cheesecake Factory , however here the food quality was terrible compared to other locations. We could not even finish our meals. 

The fries tasted like reheated, despite we sent it back and was redone. Second time the fries tasted still like a chewable gum fries. 
The portions were also seemed smaller and over spiced. 
Our main waiter was kind and helpful, however when  our food was brought out by another waiter and we asked something from him - to bring some more toasts - we never heard back.

We really looked forward this culinary experience and were really sorry for the disappointment.  We will most likely avoid the chain for a while.

Lace made our experience really enjoyable and accommodating! We were catching a flight home after our trip to the cheesecake factory and she was very helpful to make sure our service was quick and helped us keep our luggage safe. Definitely will come back when we are here again!

The food was great. Very big portions. My only complaint is that it was extremely warm inside. I'm not sure if its because the restaurant was full of people or if the AC just needed to be turned up just a little bit. But overall it was great.

I stayed at the Radisson almost a month ago. The room we stayed in was freezing, even when I turned up the thermostat. We went to get into bed and there was a HUGE stain on the sheet, to the point where we had to pull it off to sleep in the bed. I woke up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, and when I turned on the bathroom light, a bug went crawling across the floor. I also was taking the elevator to an event that I was going to the night I stayed there, and the elevator smelled of vomit, and when I told the front desk about it, they just glared at me and said they'd let someone know. It still smelled of vomit 4 hours later. Not to mention that we are almost a month after our stay, and we STILL have yet to receive our deposit of $50 back. I have called 6 times, and have left NUMEROUS voicemails, and still have yet to receive a response.  I was also told my room would be comped for the trouble, and I have yet to see that either. Will not be staying here again.
Room is outdated.  Toilet seat was broken and you are left to your own GPS mentality to locate the Casino.  The people however, are friendly, the service good and the location is close to many shops.

My organization used the ballroom and smaller rooms for an event. They were clean and well organized. Had no problem when I asked for a few things. The staff responded quickly. They did a good job managing the large group of students as well.
Nice hotel.  Convenient to local expo center.  Needs to work on the plumbing problems in my room.
Great venue for events with lots of people. Their catering is usually very good.
